resources.string: Help
The syntax is: '%1$s'
Click here to test the validation
Attention: The PDF viewer must support JavaScript to ensure functionality
Attention: The PDF viewer must support JavaScript to ensure validation
The "id" attribute is used to identify the form field. It is required to toggle form fields using the "toggles" attribute. (See checkbox and radio)
If the attribute "disabled" is set, the field cannot be edited, but the value can be copied.
If the attribute "readonly" is set, the field cannot be edited, but the value can be copied.
The "form" attribute is used to assign the form field to a form if the element is outside the form
The "value" attribute is used to specify the default value of the form field. For buttons, the value is used as a label.
If the "required" attribute is set, the field must be filled in before the form can be sent. An asterisk (*) is also displayed after the label.
The "placeholder" attribute is used to display a placeholder text in the form field. The placeholder text is only displayed if the field is empty.
The "format" attribute is used to specify the formatting of the date/time.
The "minlength" attribute is used to specify the minimum number of characters.
The "maxlength" attribute is used to specify the maximum number of characters.
The "pattern" attribute is used to specify a pattern that the value of the form field must fulfill. The pattern is specified as a regular expression.
The "patternMessage" attribute is used to display a user-defined error message if the pattern is not fulfilled.
patternMessage="Only lowercase"
<input type="text" pattern="^[a-z]*$" patternMessage="Only lowercase">
If the "checked" attribute is set, the checkbox is selected by default
The "toggles" attribute is used to show or hide other form fields when the checkbox is clicked.
toggles="id1 id2 id3"
<input type="checkbox" toggles="id1 id2 id3">
The "min" attribute is used to specify the minimum value.
The "max" attribute is used to specify the maximum value.
The "step" attribute is used to specify the step size. The "min", "value" or "step" is used here as the base value (first value set).
The "name" attribute is used to group radio buttons and ensure that only one is selected.
If the "checked" attribute is set, the radio button is selected by default. If several radio buttons in a group are marked as "checked", only the first one is selected.
Das Attribut â€žtoggles" wird verwendet, um bei Auswahl des Radiobuttons andere Formularfelder anzuzeigen oder zu verbergen.
toggles="id1 id2 id3"
<input type="radio" toggles="id1 id2 id3">
The "to" attribute specifies the e-mail address(es) to which the form is to be sent.
to="email1@example.com;email2@example.com"
<input type="submit" to="email1@example.com;email2@example.com">
The attribute "cc" specifies the e-mail address(es) to which a copy of the form should be sent.
cc="email1@example.com;email2@example.com"
<input type="submit" cc="email1@example.com;email2@example.com">
The attribute "subject" specifies the subject of the email.
subject="Subject"
<input type="submit" subject="Subject">
The "body" attribute specifies the content of the email.
body="Content"
<input type="submit" body="Content">
The "multiple" attribute is used to select multiple options. If the attribute is set, the field is displayed as a list.
The "size" attribute is used to specify the number of visible options. If the value is not set, the value that is set in the settings is used.
The "editable" attribute is used to display an input field in which the user can enter their own option. \nAttention: This is only possible if the "multiple" attribute is not set.
If the "sorted" attribute is set, the options are automatically sorted alphabetically.
The "rows" attribute is used to specify the number of visible rows. If the value is not set, the value that is set in the settings is used.
Which HTML inputs are supported?
The PDF form generator supports the following HTML input types:
The following attributes are supported:
A checkbox is displayed in the PDF form.

An input field for a date is displayed in the PDF form, whereby the input is validated. The format can be defined by the "format" attribute and is "%1$s" by default. In some PDF viewers, a button for selecting the date is also displayed.

In the PDF form, an input field for a date with time is displayed, whereby the input is validated. The format can be defined using the "format" attribute and is "%1$s" by default. In some PDF viewers, a button for selecting the date is also displayed.
An input field for an email address is displayed in the PDF form, whereby the input is validated.
https://regex101.com/r/wKBViI/1
An input field for a file is displayed in the PDF form

An input field for a month is displayed in the PDF form, whereby the input is validated. The format can be defined by the 'format' attribute and by default it is "%1$s" In some PDF viewers, a button for selecting the month is also displayed.
An input field for a number is displayed in the PDF form. It is validated whether the input is a number (optionally with a minus sign).
An input field for a password is displayed in the PDF form. The entered text is masked. (Only asterisks are displayed)
A radio button is displayed in the PDF form. If there are several radio buttons with the same "name" attribute, they are combined into a group.
A button is displayed in the PDF form that resets all form fields.
A button is displayed in the PDF form that sends the form by email when clicked. The required attribute for this is "to", "subject" and "body" are recommended, "cc" is optional.
An input field for a telephone number is displayed in the PDF form. By default, the input is not validated, but this can be achieved using the "pattern" attribute.
An input field for text is displayed in the PDF form.
An input field for a time is displayed in the PDF form, whereby the input is validated. The format can be defined by the "format" attribute and is "%1$s" by default.
An input field for a URL is displayed in the PDF form and the input is validated.
https://regex101.com/r/5EvYJP/2
Which other HTML elements are supported?

The <label> element is used to specify a label for a form field. Labels are only linked to the form field via the "for" attribute. \nIf the "for" attribute is not set or the associated form field is not found, the label is not displayed.

The <button> element is used to display a button. Only buttons with the types "reset" and "submit" are supported. For more information, see Inputs <reset> and <submit>. Instead of "value", the text within the button element is used.

Drop-down lists or list fields can be created with <select> elements. If the "multiple" attribute is set, multiple options can be selected and the field is displayed as a list. \nThe possible options are defined by "option" elements, whereby option groups are not, but their entries will be converted.
The <textarea> element is used to display a multi-line text field.
The <signature> element is used to display a field for a signature. The field is displayed as an empty rectangle in which the user can enter their digital signature.
The <fieldset> element is used to group form fields. The fieldset is displayed as a frame around the group of form fields. The child element <legend> is used to specify a label for the field set.
Where is the configuration file saved?
The configuration file is stored in the user's home directory
The path to the configuration file is:
Why does the PDF form look different than expected?

The appearance of the PDF form may differ depending on the PDF viewer. Some viewers may not display the form correctly. It is recommended to use Adobe Acrobat Reader. \nIf the problem persists, please check the configuration file and make sure that the settings are correct. \nIf the creation from a URL does not work, try saving the web page locally and using that file.
